alert.note: Alert for Harrison (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:58PM EDT until May 08 at 3:58AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in West Virginia... West Fork River Near Clarksburg affecting Harrison County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...West Fork River Near Clarksburg. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water starts to enter some homes along the low sections near the river. Libery Avenue starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EDT Saturday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 5.6 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.3 feet on 06/05/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EDT.
